briefdescription.para: The server has successfully completed the client-initiated ASE Control operation.
The server does not support the client-initiated ASE Control operation defined by the opcode written by the client.
The server has detected a truncated operation written by the client.
The server has detected that the ASE_ID written by the client does not match an ASE_ID in an exposed ASE characteristic value for that client.
The server has detected that the client-initiated ASE Control operation would cause an invalid ASE state machine transition.
The server has detected that the client-initiated ASE Control operation would cause an invalid ASE state machine transition.
The server has detected that the audio capabilities requested during a Config Codec operation are not supported (i.e., the server has not exposed the requested configuration in any PAC record)
The server has detected it does not support one or more parameter values written by the client.
The server has rejected one or more parameter values written by the client.
The server has detected one or more invalid parameter values written by the client.
The server has detected an unsupported Metadata Type written by the profile.
The server has rejected an unsupported Metadata Type written by the client.
This Response_Code is used to inform the client that the Metadata Value is incorrectly formatted.
The server is unable to successfully complete the client-initiated ASE Control operation because of insufficient resources.
The server has encountered an unspecified error.
defines the response code that shall be used when the server rejects or cannot successfully complete a client-initiated ASE Control operation.
Reason value is not applicable.
The server has detected that the codec ID value used in configuration parameters by the client is invalid.
The server has detected that the codec specific configuration value used by the client is invalid.
The server has detected that the SDU interval used in configuration parameters by the client is out of range.
The server has detected that the framing value used in configuration parameters by the client is invalid.
The server has detected that the phy value used in configuration parameters by the client is invalid.
The server has detected that the maximum sdu value used in configuration parameters by the client is invalid.
The server has detected that the retransmission number used in configuration parameters by the client is invalid.
The server has detected that the transport latency used in configuration parameters by the client is invalid.
The server has detected that the presentation delay used in configuration parameters by the client is invalid.
The server has detected that the cis value used in configuration parameters by the client is invalid.
defines the reason values that shall be used when the server rejects or cannot successfully complete a client-initiated ASE Control operation.
Invalid opcode.
Configures codec parameters for one or more ASEs.
Configures preferred CIS parameters for one or more ASEs.
Applies codec parameters and preferred CIS parameters, applies any Metadata, and starts coupling an ASE to a CIS for one or more ASEs.
Signals that the Audio Sink is ready to receive audio data transmitted by the Audio Source, and completes coupling an ASE to a CIS.
Starts decoupling a Source ASE from a CIS for one or more Source ASEs.
Signals that the Audio Sink is ready to stop receiving audio data transmitted by the Audio Source, and completes decoupling a Source ASE from a CIS.
Updates Metadata for one or more ASEs.
Releases resources associated with an ASE.
Transitions an ASE from Releasing state to the Idle state or the Codec Configured state.
Max opcode, not applicable.

ASE state is idle.
ASE state is codec configured.
ASE state is qos configured.
ASE state is in enabling.
ASE state is in streaming state.
ASE state is in disabling.
ASE state is in releasing.
Invalid ASE state.

memberdef.name: wiced_bt_ga_ascs_send_receiver_start_stop_ready

briefdescription.para: Let the peer know that the sink is ready to start/stop receive the stream.

parameterdescription.para: : start or stop receiving the stream

briefdescription.para: Length in bytes for SDU interval.
Length in bytes for Presentation Delay.
Valid Phy Mask.
ASCS can be instantiated on devices that can accept the establishment of unicast Audio Streams.

detaileddescription.para:
Examples of such devices are speakers, headsets, hearing aids, earbuds, and wireless microphones.
Two types of ASEs :
Sink ASE characteristics represent Sink ASEs, to which audio data can flow. The server is said to act as Audio Sink for that ASE. There can be more than one Sink ASE characteristic on the server.
Source ASE characteristics represent Source ASEs, from which audio data can flow. The server is said to act as Audio Source for that ASE. There can be more than one Source ASE characteristic on the server.
